stevengantz.memory.card

Class MemoryCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • stevengantz.memory.card.MemoryCard

  • public class MemoryCard
extends java.lang.Object

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Image face
      The face that is showing to the screen
      private boolean faceUp
      Whether the card is front-face-up or not
      Image frontFace
      Front face of the memory card This face is the face to check for matches
      boolean paired
      Whether the card has been paired with another card.
      private MemoryCard pairedCard
      Direct reference to the paired card, null if not paired.
      Image rearFace
      Rear face of the memory card

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MemoryCard(Image frontFace, Image rearFace)
      General constructor that builds a memory card with two faces, a front and rear.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      MemoryCard copyCard()
      Create a real copy of the memory card (hard copy) rather than copying the reference itself (soft copy).
      boolean equals(MemoryCard mem) 
      void flip()
      Mutator method for changing the card's face from front to rear or vice versa.
      Image getFace()
      Retrieve the current face value, overridden based on current conditions within the MemoryCard

      Accessor method for retrieving the front card face
      MemoryCard getPairedCard()
      Return the card this card is paired with currently

      Accessor method for retrieving the rear card face
      boolean isFaceUp()
      Accessor method for seeing whether the card is front face up
      void lockInPair(MemoryCard paired)
      Lock the card into a pair with another card
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method overrides java.lang.Object.toString and returns the current upward face as a string.

        rearFace - Rear face of the Memory Card

      • getFace

        public Image getFace()
        Retrieve the current face value, overridden based on current conditions within the MemoryCard

      • lockInPair

        public void lockInPair(MemoryCard paired)
        Lock the card into a pair with another card
        Parameters:
        paired -

      • getPairedCard

        public MemoryCard getPairedCard()
        Return the card this card is paired with currently
        Returns:
        null if not paired, paired card if paired

      • isFaceUp

        public boolean isFaceUp()
        Accessor method for seeing whether the card is front face up
        Returns:
        true or false if the card is front face up or not

      • flip

        public void flip()
        Mutator method for changing the card's face from front to rear or vice versa. If the card is front face up, this.faceUp is set to false (ie. front face down).

      • copyCard

        public MemoryCard copyCard()
        Create a real copy of the memory card (hard copy) rather than copying the reference itself (soft copy).
        Returns:
        new MemoryCard that is identical to the calling MemoryCard

      • equals

        public boolean equals(MemoryCard mem)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        This method overrides java.lang.Object.toString and returns the current upward face as a string. If the front is face up, it.toString is returned, whereas if the rear is face up, that.toString is returned.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
